item.title: Coding Resources
item.description:
A collection of useful resources for learning how to code.

Classics

  • Treehouse
  • Codecademy
  • Bentobox.io


Javascript

  • Javascript for Designers
  • Javascript and Jquery (Book)
  • Code Combat


Ruby (& Rails)

  • Try Ruby
  • Mackenzie Child’s Rails Screencasts
  • Ruby Warrior

item.title: Slack: First Year in Numbers
item.description:
Anyone following Slack’s trajectory already knows they have great numbers, but this is just ridiculous.

It’s like every message sent generated $0.01 for them.

item.title: Why Japanese Web Design Is So… Different
item.description:
A great read, specially if you follow up with Dan Grover’s Chinese Mobile App UI Trends from last December.

Now I just need someone to tell me why CDiscount, one of France’s most traditional e-commerce sites, looks like a newspaper classified ads section in 2015.

item.title: Architect walks through building in Oculus Rift; loses his shit
item.description:
He finally put the Rift off his head, his eyes were in a total state of blown away.

— I would never expect this, […] the building isn’t finished, and I’ve already been there […] as an architect, this is cheating, my god.

item.title: Facebook now offers a profile will for when you die
item.description: I can see why this is necessary, but being able to accept friend requests after you die is just weird.

item.title: Affinity Photo Beta
item.description: The photo editing application that will surely make Adobe lose some sleep is now available for (beta) download. Good discussion going on at Designer News.

item.title: Drunk Mountain Gorilla Punches Photographer
item.description: Completely drunk from eating bamboo stems, which ferment in gorillas’ stomachs causing them to become intoxicated, the primate, who is the leader of the Kwitonda Group, is said to have felt threatened by a rival male, causing him to become excitable and defensive of his territory.

item.title: The Ultimate Guide To iPhone Resolutions
item.description: Sweet guide to anyone designing for iPhone, brought to you by the folks from PaintCode App.

item.title: Boston Dynamics shows off new robot dog, dooms us all by kicking it
item.description: Seriously people, what is wrong with you? They’re already onto us, kicking them will not help our cause.

item.title: Tech’s High Barrier to Entry for the Underprivileged
item.description:
I met Maurice on February 22nd, 2014, at a high school hackathon. […]

Later that night, I received a phone call from him, and he asked if I would be able to teach him how to code. I love teaching, and Maurice seemed like a nice kid, so I offered to help. He immediately said, “okay, go,” and awaited instruction. I explained that I wouldn’t be able to teach him over the phone, but then I found out that he didn’t have internet at home.

It’s really easy to overlook these “details”, specially with the president of Y Combinator (the most prestigious accelerator in the US) tweeting stuff like this.
